newsitem.title: USA: Apple sees Q3, Q4 sequential revenue gain.
newsitem.headline: Apple sees Q3, Q4 sequential revenue gain.

text.p: Apple Computer Inc chief financial officer Fred Anderson said the company expects revenues to gain sequentially in its fiscal third and fourth quarters, compared with $1.6 billion in its second quarter.

Anderson said in a conference call with analysts and media that the company's U.S. business sales were up 35 percent in the second quarter from the first. He said Powerbook sales accounted for 22 percent of total revenue in the second quarter compared with 10 percent in the first quarter.
Apple had completed 1,200 of the total of 4,100 planned staff and contract worker layoffs by the end of March, he said.
